intro: Stenostephanus tenellus, commonly known as the slender stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a central disc of tubular florets. Stenostephanus tenellus is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
